thread.title: PM says 'get well' to Navjot Sidhu; Omar Abdullah asks why no attention to Dadri | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: PM says 'get well' to Navjot Sidhu; Omar Abdullah asks why no attention to Dadri | Deccan Chronicle

author: PTI
title: PM says 'get well' to Navjot Sidhu; Omar Abdullah asks why no attention to Dadri | Deccan Chronicle
text:
PTI | October 07, 2015, 16.49 pm NC leader and Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah. (Photo: PTI) New Delhi: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday tweeted a "get well soon" message for ailing BJP MP Navjot Singh Sidhu, a gesture which was used by NC leader Omar Abdullah to question him whether the "cold blooded" Dadri lynching incident does not merit his "attention".
"Dear @sherryontopp ji, get well soon. You are a fighter & will overcome the illness in your trademark style. Our prayers are with you," Modi said in a message to Sidhu, a party colleague and former cricketer. Sidhu is hospitalised here for a clot in his vein.
Dear @sherryontopp ji, get well soon. You are a fighter & will overcome the illness in your trademark style. Our prayers are with you.
— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) October 7, 2015 Sidhu responded by tweeting, "@narendramodi Sir, your concern means the world to me. You are a Great example & inspiration to serve my Country selflessly. Jai Hind!"
However, the Prime Minister's message on Sidhu's illness was used by Omar, a National Conference(NC) leader, to take a swipe at Modi.
"What does it say about our Hon PM that Sidhu's DVT (blood clot) got more attention from him that #Ikhlaq's cold blooded murder did!!!!," tweeted the former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister.
What does it say about our Hon PM that Sidhu's DVT (blood clot) got more attention from him that #Ikhlaq 's cold blooded murder did!!!!
— Omar Abdullah (@abdullah_omar) October 7, 2015 Ikhlaq was lynched and his son injured critically by a mob in his house in Dadri in Uttar Pradesh on September 28 following rumours that they had consumed beef.
The lynching has sparked a massive outrage but the Prime Minister has not spoken publicly yet on the deadly attack.
Tags: Narendra Modi Dadri killing Navjot Sindhu Omar Abdullah Also Read Intensive follow up meetings scheduled post Modi-Obama summit BJP, Modi misleading people on J&K married women's residency: Omar Abdullah BJP takes campaign closer to people BJP, Congress spar over Narendra Modi's 'scam India to skill India' remark
